description: A large plaza in the center of Fish-Man Island within the Ryugu Kingdom, located to the northeast of Watermill Village. It can accommodate more than 100,000 people and was historically the place where Queen Otohime gave her speeches about human-fish-man unity.

keyEvents.title: Hody Reveals His Ambitions
keyEvents.description: Hody Jones reveals his plans to take over Fish-Man Island, kill human kings at the World Summit, and become King of the Pirates at Gyoncorde Plaza.
keyEvents.significance: The plaza serves as the stage for Hody's declaration of war against humanity.

keyEvents.title: Luffy's Conqueror's Haki Display
keyEvents.description: Luffy unleashes Conqueror's Haki at Gyoncorde Plaza, knocking out 50,000 enemies in one of the series' most iconic moments.
keyEvents.significance: The plaza becomes the site of Luffy's most impressive display of Conqueror's Haki to date.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats vs New Fish-Man Pirates Battle Begins
keyEvents.description: The plaza becomes the battlefield for the decisive confrontation between the Straw Hat Pirates and the New Fish-Man Pirates.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes Gyoncorde Plaza as the location of the arc's climactic battle.

statusHistory.reason: Plaza is being used by Hody Jones for his public execution and confrontation

description: A mystical forest located at the bottom of the sea on Fish-Man Island, filled with sunken ships and coral. It serves as the resting place of Queen Otohime and Fisher Tiger's grave.

keyEvents.title: Jinbe Devises Plan with Straw Hats
keyEvents.description: In flashback, the Sea Forest is shown as the location where Jinbe met with the Straw Hats to devise their strategy to save Fish-Man Island.
keyEvents.significance: The Sea Forest serves as the planning location for the operation against Hody Jones.

description: The royal palace of the Ryugu Kingdom on Fish-Man Island, home to King Neptune and the royal family. It's a magnificent underwater castle.

keyEvents.title: Zoro, Usopp, and Brook's Escape
keyEvents.description: In flashback, the flooded palace is shown as the location where Zoro, Usopp, and Brook were imprisoned before Pappag helped them escape.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the palace in a state of crisis during Hody's takeover.

statusHistory.reason: Palace has been flooded and taken over by the New Fish-Man Pirates
